Class MathUtil

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.susx.mlcl.lib.MathUtil

public class MathUtil
extends Object

Utility class to hold a number of static maths functions.

Author:
Hamish Morgan <hamish.morgan@sussex.ac.uk>

Normalise the angle theta: so it is in the range: 0 <= a < 2*pi

angleBetween

public static double angleBetween(double ax,
                                  double ay,
                                  double bx,
                                  double by)
Return the angle in radians between the 2d vectors defined by the parameters.

Parameters:
ax - x-axis component of the first vector
ay - y-axis component of the first vector
bx - x-axis component of the second vector
by - y-axis component of the second vector
Returns:
angle between the vectors

epsilonEquals

public static boolean epsilonEquals(double a,
                                    double b,
                                    double epsilon)
Calculate whether the two scalars (a and b) are equal, given some slack value epsilon. This allows floating point values to be compared for approximate equality, such that floating point errors are alleviated.

Parameters:
a - first value to compare
b - second value to compare
epsilon - amount of difference allowed
Returns:
true if the values with epsilon, false otherwise
